questiontext.text:
Example

If \(\displaystyle{{\cal L}\{f(t)\}=F(s)\quad \text{ and}\quad {d^2f\over {dt^2}}-{df\over {dt}}=3t}\) with initial conditions \(f(0)=1,\quad f'(0)=0\), find the explicit expression for \(F(s)\).


  1. Begin by finding \(\displaystyle{{\cal L}\biggl\{{d^2f\over {dt^2}}\biggr\},\ \ {\cal L}\biggl\{{df\over {dt}}\biggr\}\ \text{ and}\ {\cal L}\{3t\}}\)

    Solution

    \[\begin{eqnarray*} {\cal L}\{3t\}&=&3/s^2\\ {\cal L}\biggl\{{df\over {dt}}\biggr\}&=&-f(0)+sF(s)=-1+sF(s)\\ {\cal L}\biggl\{{d^2f\over {dt^2}}\biggr\}&=&-f'(0)-sf(0)+s^2F(s)=-s+s^2F(s) \end{eqnarray*}\]

  2. Now complete the calculation to find \(F(s)\):

    Solution

    You should find \(\quad\displaystyle {F(s)={s^3-s^2+3\over s^3(s-1)}}\)
    since, using the transforms we have found: \[\begin{eqnarray*} -s+s^2F(s)-(-1+sF(s))&=&{3\over {s^2}}\\\text{ so}\qquad F(s)[s^2-s]&=&{3\over {s^2}}+s-1={s^3-s^2+3\over {s^2}} \end{eqnarray*}\] leading to \( \displaystyle F(s)={s^3-s^2+3\over s^3(s-1)}\)
